text.section: If a defendant is found guilty of a violation under this part and a fine is imposed, a court may direct that the payment of the fine be suspended or deferred under conditions determined by the court.
A defendant's willful failure to pay a fine imposed under this part may be treated as a criminal contempt punishable as provided by law.

A defendant who is found guilty of a violation under this part, as provided by law for a criminal case, may file:
an appeal;
a motion for a new trial; or
a motion for a revision of a judgment.

The State's Attorney for each county may:
prosecute a violation under this part in the same manner as a prosecution of a criminal case, including entering a nolle prosequi or placing the case on violation on a stet docket; and
exercise authority in the same manner prescribed by law for a violation of the criminal laws of the State.
